title: Why Projects Fail
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Why Projects Fail.

hook.text: The Standish Group found that only 29% of software projects succeed. The rest fail or are challenged.

buildup.text: Common killers include unclear requirements, poor communication, and unrealistic deadlines.

discovery.text: Technical skill alone doesn't save projects. The human side â€” expectations, feedback, trust â€” matters more.

twist.text: Many failed projects had brilliant engineers. They built the wrong thing perfectly.

climax.text: Every methodology invented since tries to fix one root problem: building the right thing right.

punchline.text: Building it right matters less than building right.

quiz.question: What is the most common reason software projects fail?
